I think they really are - isn't there some tone or range of sound that onl=
y kids can hear and shopowners use it to keep teens from hanging out there?=


I saw a show about it but can't remember what it is called now or why the=
y can hear it but most adults can't.

 

L.

 question



I think that the children may even be better at hearing the vo=
ices.



On Thu, Jan 22, 2009 at 1:12 PM, Misty Dawn <[mailto:bulletbabea@y=
ahoo.com] bulletbabea@...> wrote:











RJ
I think the answers w=
ill vary from individual to individual based on thier beliefs. As for me pe=
rsonally I grew up surrounded by unexplained events and my parents tried to=
 ignore the things that they couldnt see because if you ignore it then it d=
oesnt exist right? But there comes a time when the child grows up and forms=
 thier own ideas and beliefs. Personally speaking once I reached adulthood =
there were many other people who experienced the same things I did in that =
house so I began to see that there was more to it than just a childs imagin=
ation.

Most religions are based upon the idea that there is a higher power=
, that we all have spirits, and that there is something beyond this life. T=
o say that someone is wrong for belief in ghosts I would have to say that b=
illions of others are wrong for having belief at all. I dont think bad of a=
 parent who takes their kids off to church every sunday nor do I think badl=
y about a parent who spends some time doing ITC. Telling a child that there=
 is more than what the eye can see, more than what the ears can hear, is gi=
ving them the basics for growing up with a mind thats open to possibility. =
What they do with that is up to them individually.

I worry more about the =
kids who grow up with parents who are alchoholics, drug addicts, liars, thi=
eves, abusers, etcetera.. than anyone. 

As for if the effect is positive o=
r negative, I think that has to do with the intent or the approach taken by=
 each individual whether it be ITC, religion, or life in general.

Misty


=
